page.title: 03Landscape MAXEY & ETTON
page.content: {Maxey,}(pop. 650) is a small village 8 miles north of Peterborough. Maxey has a small village shop with a post office. The shop closes at 6:30 most nights except Wednesdays and Saturdays when it closes at 1:00. It has one pub. There is one park with a roundabout, a climbing frame, logs and barrels. In Maxey there is one bus stop and a coach company called Shaws, but only two busses call each day. Maxey has a community centre, one phone box and two post boxes. In Maxey there are some gravel pits. { Etton,}(pop. 90) has a pub called The Golden Pheasant. Etton also has a post office, which sells things from paper to stamps. Etton has one phone box and one post box. Not many children live in Etton. Those that do are taken by school bus to either Glinton or Northborough School.
